result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey L. Walkotten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Park, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
May not have contact with felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  
*  Pay prosecution costs of $1840.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE to Sheboygan 10CF280and concurrent to Ct. 1

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
May not have contact with felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Pay prosecution costs in Ct. 1

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE to Cts 1 & 2 and concurrent to Ct. 4.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Powers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court orders prosecution costs of $1,840.  Statement by Kelly W., Erin W., Wayne W.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP consecutive to Sheboygan 10CF280; 1 year initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 2 the court imposes total sentence of 3 years WSP concurrent to ct 1 and consecutive to Sheboygan 10CF280; 1 year initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; on ct 4 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions consecutive to cts 1 & 2; on ct 5 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions consecutive to cts 1 & 2 and concurrent to ct 4; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $1,000 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Powers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 3, 6 & 7 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1, 2, 4 & 5.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1, 2, 4 & 5.  PSI ordered.  SEH 4/24/15 at 10am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Powers and ADA Delgado the FPT of 1/8/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as the deft has a SEHR on January 29th in Sheboygan; reset to 2/17/15 at 8:45 am.

With Atty Powers and ADA Delgado the FPT of 11/26/14 at 10am is rescheduled, as the deft has been revoked and has had his administrative appeal denied and a sentencing after revocation is pending in Sheboygan; reset to 1/8/15 at 8:45am.
